articles.author: Aaron Brown
articles.summary: A paper from researchers at hedge fund AQR Capital Management and Yale University claims that more complex models outperform simpler ones. At least six papers have since challenged the findings of the paper, which Bryan Kelly has since defended. The paper addresses one of the most important questions in finance: Will artificial intelligence replace human researchers and traders?

articles.title: ChatGPT clarifies machine-learning positives, negatives and infrastructure requirements
articles.author: Brian Gilliland
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is making repetitive tasks less labor-intensive and even obsolete. It is used to explain complex topics and summarize large amounts of information. It can also be used to make routine or repetitive tasks easier. It's used to solve problems and summarize information.

articles.title: 2 Artificial Intelligence Stocks You Can Buy and Hold for the Next Decade
articles.author: John Ballard
articles.summary: The growth of artificial intelligence (AI) is the biggest opportunity in technology since the internet and PC adoption in the 1990s. Top tech companies report surging demand across cloud services, software, and semiconductors. Applied Digital is a data center builder with a market cap of $3.7 billion. Microsoft's cloud business reported accelerating growth last quarter, as businesses race to catch up in AI.

articles.title: Charlie Brooker Fears AI Scripting
articles.summary: Charlie Brooker is concerned about the development of artificial intelligence in the creative industry and its potential to replace writers. He is optimistic about the inherent value of human-driven storytelling. He believes that audiences will always crave narratives rooted in genuine human experience. He also touches on the practicalities of his work, like securing A-list talent and the thematic explorations within Black Mirror.

articles.title: I attended an AI class for older Americans. The students couldn't have been more excited.

articles.summary: Some of New York City's most ambitious AI adopters aged 60 and over attended a Tuesday Intro to Chatting with AI class run by Senior Planet, an AARP subsidiary. Many people in their 80s use AI at work or home, whether for maintaining client lists, seeking coding advice or planning a vacation to Mexico.

articles.title: ‘It's almost tragic': Bubble or not, the AI backlash is validating what one researcher and critic has been saying for years
articles.author: Nick Lichtenberg
articles.summary: OpenAI's release of GPT-5 has caused a tech sell-off. The value of the S&P 500 was down by $1 trillion. Gary Marcus has been warning of the limits of large language models (LLMs) since 2019 and warning of a potential AI bubble and problematic economics since 2023.

articles.title: 'It's almost tragic': Bubble or not, the AI backlash is validating one critic's warnings

articles.summary: OpenAI released GPT-5 and Sam Altman called it 'totally screwed up'. MIT survey found that 95% of AI pilots at companies are working on generative AI pilots.    .      in the survey.

articles.title: AI passed the aesthetic Turing Test, raising big questions for art
articles.author: The Conversation
articles.summary: The Vogue ad featuring a model created by artificial intelligence has caused a backlash. It raises questions about the future of art in a synthetic world. AI can generate music, images, and movies so convincingly that people struggle to distinguish them from human creations. In the recent explosion of powerful chatbots, the original Turing Test for conversation has been passed.

articles.title: Here's why artificial intelligence (AI) could make passive income more important
articles.author: Ben McPoland
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is changing the world of work. It can lower costs, boost productivity and fatten profit margins. In the UK, youth unemployment is rising, with some saying AI is a factor (fewer entry-level jobs). Passive income from dividends could help cover living expenses if a primary job is lost. articles.summary: A municipal office in Ichinoseki in northeastern Japan has introduced an AI-powered terminal to help residents with tasks such as filling out documents. articles.title: UDST marks graduation of two cohorts in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: The Peninsula
articles.summary: Since the launch of the Bachelor's in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence programme in 2021, more than two cohorts have graduated, joining the workforce in one of the world's fastest-growing fields. articles.title: Outsized Hype About ChatGPT GPT-5 Being Totally Honest AI Is Basically A Big Fib
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: The recent release of OpenAI's GPT-5 and the ongoing use of ChatGPT has created a lot of hype about AI being more forthright and less likely to tell lies. In fact, AI does not strictly abides by truth-telling and sometimes it overreaches on its data patterns and sometimes provides an answer to you that isn't true. The rise in AI ethics and the looming legal threat of new laws that punish AI makers for excessively lies are factors regarding how AI ought to be shaped.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman Says Parenthood Has 'Rewired' His Priorities And Approach To AI Development: 'Best, Most Amazing Thing Ever'
articles.author: Sam Altman
articles.summary: Sam Altman and his husband, Oliver Mulherin, welcomed a baby boy via surrogacy in February. Altman is the CEO of OpenAI. He shares his thoughts on artificial intelligence with Fortune's Rewired Priorities podcast.    .

articles.title: To prepare students for an AI world, colleges should give them a break from AI
articles.summary: Universities are clamoring to partner with companies selling chatbots and generative AI products and providing workshops for faculty on how to teach with AI. Kimberly Atkins Stohr is skeptical about the value of AI in higher education. She thinks the humanities and other disciplines can thrive in the age of AI only by fostering and showcasing distinctively human capacities.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Has Arrived in Humboldt Commercials, and People Have Opinions
articles.summary: Local production company owner Tex Kelly used a generative AI program to place computer-generated cryptids in the real interior of Eureka Mexican restaurant Esmeralda's 2.0 for a video advertisement. articles.summary: Sukh Sroay has found "Human Mode" for AI writing. It's a guide for writing in plain English with short sentences. The rules are to be direct and concise, use a natural, conversational tone, avoid hype and clichés, cut adverbs and filler, and give concrete examples and steps.

articles.title: SHERI FEW: The AI Threat To Critical Thinking In Our Classrooms
articles.summary: Technology has no place in kindergarten through eighth grade (K-8). Learning through books, pencil and paper and dialogue with real people builds the strongest foundation for learning and provides cognitive, emotional and practical benefits. The expensive private Waldorf School of the Peninsula in the Silicon Valley has ZERO technology in grades K-8.
